"Oi, you th' 'ead collectin' witch yeah?" The man asked casually, lightly kicking the headless woman in the shin.

"Ey, use yer telepathy! People could eavesdrop!" The female said, jabbing the man in the ribs with her elbow.

"Ah rite." He said, shrugging as though he didn't care one way or the other if he was overheard. He did oblige his partner, however, as without moving his lips The Collector heard him continue speaking. "You can 'ear me, yeah? You're that witch 'ts'been 'arassing gals out in th' woods, yeah?"

The Collector didn't answer immediately. It had been so long since she'd spoken through indirect telepathy. Most of her telepathic conversations were with heads that she had attached to her body, a spell so simple it all but cast itself. An indirect telepathy spell was significantly more complex, so much so that The Collector had never learned it That's why she had to talk with her phone or a pen and paper while headless. If he was using it, and if his partner knew of it, the two were probably... "You're magic users too?" The Collector thought at him.

"Yep. Name's Caleb, 'n the ugly one is Lynne." He thought, smirking.

"Not such a shiny pot yerself, y'know! Got gals linin' up to rub noses with ye?" The Collector heard, Lynne's voice clear despite her lack of moving lips. She knew the spell too, it seemed, and had decided to drop in on the conversation.

"Least I got my brains t' fall back on. Knew this was the 'ead witch 's soon 's I saw 'er, unlike some thick Lynne's I know." He thought, folding his arms and adopting a self satisfied smile. Lynne elbowed him again, causing Caleb to shove her shoulder, and the pair broke out in a fit of rowdy laughter.

"So, you're magic users, and you're some type of British. Would you care to tell me what you're doing all the way out here?" The Collector thought at them. While the pair seemed friendly enough, their physiques and appearances still intimidated The Collector, and the fact that they were both magic users only deepened her unease.

"I s'ppose." Caleb thought, shrugging. "We're agents of th' International Wizarding Guild, 'ere to investigate an unlicensed magic user 'ose been stealing dames' heads'n releasin' their unsupervised 'n uncontrolled bodies into the wild. So, s'ppose Lynne'n'I're investigatin' you."

The Collector's empty shoulders wiggled, the closest thing she could do to gulping. She knew there were other magic users out there in the world, she'd had a teacher a long time ago after all, but she had no idea they were so organized. An international guild? How had she never heard about this. And why are they investigating her?

"Why are you investigating me?" She asked.

Caleb's brow furrowed, trying to come up with a good way to explain. Before he could find that way, Lynne answered The Collector, informing her that the Guild...

Maria had mentioned having a sister once before, in passing conversation. She had never mentioned that said sister was an identical twin, but why would she? It would be a weird thing to bring up to your kidnapper, and maybe she was embarrassed. After all, she was everything her sister wasn't. Or, maybe her sister HAD been like her, but had switched up her look and outlook after Maria went missing. Maybe Maria was trying to protect her? 1441.content:
**BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP**

Despite the advanced warning, The Collector was so caught up in her head snatching attempt that she was completely unable to react to the sudden stopping of the bus, her feet thrown clean out from under her and her body launched forward into bus' pay station. "OW!" The Collector thought, reaching to rub the shoulder that had absorbed the brunt of the impact before remembering the rues. Bodies didn't register or respond to pain. Nor did they get up on their own when knocked down. The Collector sighed silently. She had to play dumb.

"Dumb body." The bus driver said, confirming The Collector's acting abilities. A few passengers groaned as the driver put the bus in park so that she could assist you, their journey delayed. "You, body, stand." The driver instructed in a clear and loud voice, wrapping her arms through the body's armpits and linking them under its chest. She manhandled the torso upright, and as per her instructions The Collector stood up in a slow and rehearsed series of motions. With the body standing at attention, the bus driver came around and looked at its chest, then its arms, then walked around to its back again, her face transitioning from annoyed to confused and right back to annoyed again. "No tag, are you joking?" She muttered.

Since bodies were so easily knocked out of their rhythm, most caretakers affixed an index card somewhere on the body indicating the body's home address, their caretaker's phone number, what their instructions had been, and what the caretaker would prefer you do should the body become disoriented (whether to walk it back home, reprogram its instructions, call the owner, etc.) Since The Collector had come to this city on a spur of the moment decision she hadn't thought to make herself a tag and even if yoshe did she didn't fancy fabricating a cover story that someone might be able to debunk and cause even more trouble than just playing dumb would have.

Sighing heavily, the bus driver stepped out of the vehicle to check her cross-streets, then returned to the bus and said in an authoritative tone "You, body, exit vehicle." The Collector did as instructed, turning mechanically and marching out onto the pavement. "You, body, turn left, walk three blocks, turn right, walk two blocks." She instructed. While The Collector didn't know this city well enough to say with total certainty, she were 95% sure that the bus driver was guiding her to a police station. There they would attempt to identify her and return the body to its caretakers, or otherwise put it into one of their storage facilities. Being The Collecter herself, The Collector didn't particularly fancy waltzing straight into a police station. They PROBABLY wouldn't be able to identify her, but just the possibility that they would and that she'd be instantly thrown in irons and interrogated made The Collector's skin crawl.

Realizing that she'd been standing still and not following the bus driver's instructions for a soon to be suspiciously long amount of time, The Collector...

The same goes to any heads who were also actresses either they are more experienced or not. In a way, the collector fears and respects the head. In fact, Christi is the type to refuse to be attached to the collector unless she proves herself worthy.

Despite how strict the head is, she is kind and warm to others on other matters. The best way to describe that side of her is that she is like an older sister. She does respect actress heads that are older than her but will not hesitate on criticizing them if needed.

The head has long blond hair with some locks tied at the back of her hair. While she has a young aura to her, she is surprisingly older than you think as she is about 19. One could mistake her for being a high school senior.

One thing she wishes is to get a gig again instead of being stuck on the shelf. Or at least her friends get an opportunity in acting. Either she and they get a new body or be able to act as heads. She does get nervous over how society would not accept her for her bodiless state even though she wants to be seen again.

So what would we do with the head?

15221.content:
Stella was sitting on the shelf with her eyes closed as she meditated. She spent her time finding inner peace and lacking a body has helped her do so. She felt more at ease until...

"I'M BORED!"

Stella opened her left eye as she saw her neighbor being impulsive and impatient. The head next to her is Sunny, a tan brown twin tailed haired head with a happy go lucky and energetic personality. She often is the head used when the collector needs to feel more positive about life.

"The collector hasn't put me on for a while and I got nothing to do," Sunny said, "But that might mean that she is not sad so I should be happy!"

Stella just smiled as she tried to meditate again. The collector has put Stella next to the more social heads so that Stella would be able to talk to others better. It sort of worked, but Stella doesn't care.

"Do you truly feel happiness from the happiness of others?" Stella asked with her eyes still closed.

"Of course! I feel happy for my body out there having fun! I'm happy for the collector feeling good about herself. And what's this? I made you smile! Everyone told me that you barely do!" Sunny said.

"I can smile," Stella said, "I choose not to. Though being around you is pretty infectious."

"I'm so happy for you," Sunny said.

"But what about yourself?" Stella asked, "Sure you are happy for others, but have you felt happy for yourself."

"Yeah! The fact that I can still do something without a body is enough to keep me smiling. Since I'm a head, I have a face and it's my job for my face to keep smiling," Sunny said.

"I don't know, something tells me that you are hiding a frown under there," Stella said.

"That's mean," Sunny said, "I'm doing my best to make the sadness here go away for the heads here. I do admit that I don't like seeing the heads here sad. Someone's got to be their sunshine in this room!"

"Woe is you to take such a heavy burden for us all. I am not mocking you as I feel pity," Stella said.

"Don't worry! I'll be fine! Maybe you can join me!" Sunny said.

"I don't know," Stella said.

"We could make an event where we show the joys of being here! Maybe that will raise the morale here!" Sunny said.

"Wow, this girl is dense. She's interesting," Stella thought to herself, "Maybe I should follow her to see where this goes. On the other hand, it seems like trouble."

153.content:
"Shit." The Collector's head muttered, mirroring her master's thoughts without the Collector even needing to put her on or tell her. Shit, indeed. How could this have happened? "How could this have happened?" The head said, this time preempting the Collector's thoughts.

The two watched a blue and black sea of police officers, search and rescue operators, deputized members of the local populace, news crews, and even an FBI agent swarmed into and around the Collector's ostensibly abandoned cabin, which served as a front for her main base of operations and home to her lair. Nearly her entire collection was stored there, nearly 500 heads of all ages, races, classes, and from several decades.

Now, however, those 500 heads were slowly amassing in a heap outside, the deputies stacking them in rows while a few officers went to work identifying anyone they could. Some heads were laughing and praising the men and women who'd finally saved them, others were crying out for the Collector to come and rescue them from their rescuers, others still were silent, either in shock or simply not sure what to make of this turn of events.

The collector wanted to scream. She might have screamed, had she been wearing her head when she got back to her cabin. How could this have happened? How could they have found out her hiding place? What was she going to do now?

All was not entirely lost, she still had about 20 heads scattered in hidden locations around the forrest, as well as a much smaller collection of about a dozen heads hidden away in the cellar beneath a second cabin, located FAR away from this one, which she had started building once she realized that she couldn't excavate any more space beneath her current dwelling without risking a cave-in. Plus, she had a few 3-4 head stashes in other countries, hidden for when she took international trips and found heads that struck her fancy, but which she couldn't transport back to her neck of the woods until the heat died down.

But this was her home. These were the majority of her heads. And they were getting reclaimed. "What are we gonna do now, ma'am?" the Collector's head asked. The Collector pat the thick mop of turquoise dyed hair belonging to Chloe, one of the Collector's most loyal heads. She was one of the only heads that the Collector ever allowed to take temporary control of her body, and had always considered her a sort of adviser. She was lucky, if nothing else, that she hadn't lost her. "I mean, I hate to say this, but there's way too many of them down there. Even if you tried to pick off the stragglers one by one, eventually you'd get caught and catch a bullet. Or they'll call in back up before you can get all your heads moved to some place new."

The Collector observed the scene before her. At least two dozen people were buzzing around her cabin, police officers surrounding the place with weapons drawn and floodlights scanning the forest for the Collector while deputies ran into and out of the cabin carrying armfuls of heads and rescue teams tried to comfort and identify them as they were laid in heaps on a series of large blue tarps spread out around the building. A young newslady was speaking to her camera wielding crew about the massive find, and was holding up the head of Heather Jueves, a beautiful thirty year old hispanic news anchor that the Collector had swiped back in the late 90's and who was now giving her first televised interview in over twenty years. In short, there were eyes everywhere, and the chances of the Collector getting in unseen, incapacitating every able bodied person around her home, and getting all of her heads to some place safe and discreet (which she did not even know where that would be) was, as Chloe had pointed out, impossible. That said, running wasn't going to be easy. Without her, these heads had no way of getting their bodies back, even if they could be found and not many of them could. They would be looking for her, and if she ran back to her secondary cabin they might get on her trail and find that one too. That said, what if one of the heads told the police where the cabin was? She only gave that information to her most trusted heads, but what if they had blabbed it to some of the less good ones, or what if they cracked under interrogation? The Collector...

So one night, the collector remained headless while her four remaining heads watched a youtube video featuring Lina with her old body again. As a side effect of being with the collector, the victims could take their head off when they feel like it and control their body. The video is mostly about Lina returning to her original body and she speaks no ill will against the collector.

"Man, I miss that girl," Chloe said.

"Wait... I do need to sleep and prepare for my short concert in the afternoon and Tammy has the morning job," Chloe said.

"We do need to focus on what to do with the master's collection as well," Tammy said, "And I'm starting to feel tired now."

info.brief_description: Based on Return to Oz, this story is about a woman who likes to collect heads.
info.description:
The story is about a head collector who goes out stealing heads for collection and accessory sake. She mostly spend her times either going out to get heads, grooming her current collection, or trying on her collection.

Rules: Descent grammar is appreciated.

Characters and recurring characters:

The collector: An odd headless bodies that likes to collect beautiful heads of girls. She only targets beautiful girls and either ignores or kill anyone else who gets in her way. At best, not care for the ones she is not into. She is often really eccentric and odd while having a strange caring side to her as she loves her heads and likes to abduct them from helpless victims. She is pretty open-minded of things to an extent just to make her heads happy like letting them use the internet if they can. She also learns from the heads she collected like playing music or speaking another language. She can be reckless as some of her choices involves charging into things. She barely acts serious usually unless her heads are in distress.

Lina: A former youtuber that's into the dark arts and all. She lost her head to the collector after a deal with a devil gone wrong. Despite this, the head is content with being part of the collection and serves the collector as a loyal servant thanks to the contract. She often speaks all dramatic and all which the collector finds cute. She still make youtube videos with the collector and as a head.

Chloe: The collector's guitar instructor and one of the main advisors for the collector. She is mostly taken for both her beauty and guitar skills. She is often wise in her odd way and seem to have some authority over the collector even if she isn't teacher her guitar.

Most of the heads are female and human.

[Updates] Fictional female characters can appear in this story as part of the collection.

Also I should of been more clear that the collection is filled with humanoid heads. Aliens can appear and anthros to an extent. Just no animals in general.

Have fun.
